home.title: Services for regeneration, eco-literacy, and nature-based solutions
home.lead: We help people, communities, and organizations reconnect with nature, imagine new horizons, and drive transformative change.
home.what_p1: Livlin offers services for regeneration, eco-literacy, and nature-based solutions.
home.what_p2: Facing the planetary triple crisis—climate change, pollution, and biodiversity loss—we work with a collaborative and educational approach, bringing together science, local knowledge, and regenerative practices to deliver real change.
home.card1_text: Design and implementation of practices adapted to urban, peri-urban, and rural contexts.

services.title: Livlin Professional Services
services.lead: Four strategic lines integrating science, practice, and technology.

s1.title: Agroecology & Nature-based Solutions
s1.desc: Agroecological practices adapted to different realities.
s1.li1: Urban and community gardens (yards, rooftops, schools, shared spaces).
s1.li2: Wicking beds (self-watering planters) for water efficiency and stable production.
s1.li3: Composting & vermiculture: organic waste systems and training.
s1.li4: Replication kits and manuals to scale solutions.

s2.title: Research & Knowledge Management
s2.desc: Scientific rigor and participatory methods for sound decisions.
s2.li2: Mixed methods: interviews, surveys, mapping, network analysis, statistics.
s2.li3: Social and environmental impact evaluation in people and territories.

s3.title: Digital Solutions
s3.desc: Open and sustainable tech for management, learning, and decision-making.
s3.li1: Information management and planning tools (web platforms).
s3.li2: Territorial, social, or environmental data explorers.
s3.li4: Interactive educational apps (games, simulators, learning apps).

s4.title: Facilitation & Training
s4.li1: Theories of Change with strategic focus and MEL.
s4.li2: Facilitation of participatory processes (workshops, visual methods).
s4.li3: Indicator systems aligned with national and global frameworks.
s4.li4: Hands-on workshops: gardening, composting, irrigation, vermiculture, recycling, biodiversity.
s4.li5: Training on simple technologies and open digital tools.
s4.li6: Individual and group mentoring for regenerative projects.

about.title: About us
about.lead: We connect science, technology, and agroecological practice to transform places.
about.subtitle: Sociologist | Permaculture Designer
about.bio_html:
I am a Sociologist and Data Officer at the technical secretariat of the Global Race to Resilience Campaign, where I combine applied social research, data analysis, and digital app development to support global climate action.

In parallel, I am part of the AUCCA Ecopedagogical Center and a coordinator in the Urban Agroecology Movement (MAU, Chile), strengthening community regenerative practices.

As the founder of Livlin, I offer professional services for regeneration, eco-literacy, and nature-based approaches, combining agroecology consulting, organic waste and compost systems, resilient growing with self-watering planters and capillary irrigation, as well as web app development and facilitation using Theory of Change.

My background includes an MA and BA in Sociology (UAH), a Diploma in Chinese Studies (U. of Chile), and a Permaculture Design Certificate (El Manzano, Chile).

I believe global climate challenges are chances to learn from nature and plant hope. My purpose is to contribute to the global pulse of regeneration by connecting science, technology, and agroecological practice to transform our places and organizations.
